mittelbayerische.de.307290.1: Fleetwood Mac co-founder Peter Green died
mittelbayerische.de.307290.2: His life was like a rollercoaster ride: After a rapid climb with Fleetwood Mac it went steeply downhill and then slowly uphill again.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.3: Now the blues rock guitarist Peter Green has died at the age of 73.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.4: Brilliant guitarist, drug junkie, cult fan: The co-founder of the band Fleetwood Mac, Peter Green, is dead.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.5: He had died peacefully in his sleep at the age of 73, family members said in an official statement on Saturday that a further statement would be announced for the next few days.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.6: Top musicians like Peter Frampton praised Green as one of the best blues and rock guitarists.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.7: Mick Fleetwood spoke in an emotional reaction of a "monumental loss" for all former and current members of the band Fleetwood Mac.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.8: The drummer Fleetwood and the guitarist Green formed the now legendary band in London in 1967, his dreamy instrumental hit "Albatross" is still unforgotten.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.9: The musician's life ("The End Of The Game," "In The Skies") was like a rollercoaster ride.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.10: With Fleetwood Mac, Green experienced a rapid rise - but the band celebrated their greatest successes without him.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.11: Among other things, there was a dispute because Green wanted to donate all the group's profits to charity.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.12: He began to perform in wide robes and with a big crucifix.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.13: Psychological problems are also said to have played a role.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.14: Three years after the band was formed, Green left the band in 1970.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.15: This was followed by a social decline.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.16: The blues rock guitarist suffered from drug abuse and schizophrenia, biographers reported.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.17: For a long time Green was treated in psychiatry.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.18: During much of the 1970s, the musician disappeared from the scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.19: He is said to have temporarily lived on the street, worked as a cemetery gardener and spent some time in an Israeli kibbutz.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.20: Green was born in 1946 as the son of a Jewish working-class family in the London district of Bethnal Green.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.21: From a young age he was enthusiastic about US blues musicians such as B.B. King and Muddy Waters.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.22: At the age of eleven he learned the first guitar grips.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.23: At the age of 15, the teenager started playing guitar professionally and five years later got the chance to play lead guitarist for the instrumental band Peter B's Looners.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.24: Shortly afterwards he was hired as a replacement for his idol Eric Clapton with the Bluesbreakers.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.25: In the middle of the blues boom, Green founded Fleetwood Mac in the summer of 1967 together with his Bluesbreakers colleagues Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.26: The song "Albatross," composed by Green, gave the group the first number 1 hit in the winter of 1968 / 69 and catapulted them to the top of the British music scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.27: But the rapid rise soon showed its downsides: Green could not cope with the media hype, his experiments with the drug LSD became more and more extreme.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.28: He later commented on the life between music and addiction in an interview: "The worst thing that happened to me in life is drugs - the best thing was to land a number one hit."
mittelbayerische.de.307290.29: Towards the end of the decade, Green achieved a surprising success in 1979 with an album inspired by religious themes.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.30: Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac swam without him in a new formation on a wave of success.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.31: Their 1977 album "Rumours" sold more than 40 million copies worldwide.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.32: Despite various small solo successes, Green did not make a major comeback until he started again in 1996 with a group of musician friends.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.33: The British "Daily Telegraph" spoke of a rock star returning to Earth.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.34: Free of drugs, Green released some albums with the Peter Green Splinter Group until the band broke up in 2004.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.35: He was a blues legend for music experts during his lifetime - and with his soft sound he was one of the most influential guitarists of the past decades.
